reviews.review_msg: AWSOME

Amazing T.A. Very easy going and always open to questions. I found him helpful and interesting--one of the best T.A.s I've had! And it is possible to get more than a B+ in the course with him as a T.A.-I finished with an A and it wasn't an unreasonable workload.
this guy is so laid back, you can do just about anything and he'll be ok with it.

Yes, yes.  The infamous CMNS 110 TA.  Good guy and easy marker (despite my rating of "2").  However, he marks everyone on the same level.  There's no way of getting anything above a B+ w/ him as a TA.

he's good enough to take a course with. yes we can go with him and even take him again. but get ready to read . loads of readings to be done. and probably the longest essay you will ever write will be for this course.
Very nice instructor with lots of humour.

It was one of the best course in FIC, Anis very good proff tries to engage class . He is very gentle . Please do the reading and do not be late on his class. If you do not  understand please ask him he will explain everything .  Test are NOR hard if you will do the reading you will  be fine

Anis's lectures alright. He really tries to make the class engaging and tries to make jokes (so I'll give him credit for that). Exams were fair. Overall not a difficult course itself, if you understand the concepts and material.

Anis's lectures are not too bad, at times hard to understand but he covers the basics of the course pretty well. Some lectures he can go off on tangents that are a bit confusing. Midterm, term paper, final. Exams were essay based, but we got choices about what we wanted to write about. An okay prof and class.

He's a good prof, the content is sometimes a little dry, but only like 2 or 3 of the lectures. the rest is pretty interesting. his tests are fair and pretty easy. i didn't read most of the readings and just listened in class and he'll tell u what's important and hint you that it'll be on the exam. not hard at all

Anis is very passionate about the subject and clearly cares a lot about his students, often encouraging people to speak up and ask questions. Like others have said, he does have an accent but it does not really deter from the lecture itself as long as you are paying attention.

Anis was an excellent professor! I had the privledge of being a student in his CMNS 110 class, in which he inspired me to pursue a minor in CMNS. Anis is funny, caring and passionate about the study of communication. Extremely interesting lectures, in particular, the conditions of production of the iPhone and Joe Fresh clothing.

Anis is a great prof. The below complaints about his accent are far too many! Or maybe he has improved because I had no problem understanding him. He is approachable, funny, and enthusiastic about topics. Such an interesting course. Some of the reading topics are brilliant.

If you go to his office hours, he will help you, even if your term paper is due the next day, he dissect the topic for you and tell you exactly what to do, he is extremely helpful and passionate. His exams aren't hard, the readings are long, some are interesting some are not, his lectures are funny, engaging, and he really does care about students.

I didn't even read the weekly readings, as long as you kinda pay attention in class and know the main theories and stuff, the rest is pretty much common sense. make sure to relate to real life examples on the midterm. his accent is kinda hard to understand but the slides are clear. the term paper is really easy, no hard topics or anything.

Anis really cared about his students, but his lectures were often unclear and his accent made it hard to understand.  There are also a ton of readings that are unrelated to each other, and he doesn't connect the reading to lecture much.  However, he did take into account student feedback and offered to join a study group to prep for exams.

Passionate about topics; accent may make lecture difficult to understand because he may talk fast as well. Readings were extremely boring....10-20 pages long each and many many big words. Midterm and final consists of two essays per exam.

He is a very nice man and very enthusiastic about teaching. The lectures are a drag and he tends to ramble which gets the class off topic and as a result causes him to rush, which makes it really hard to understand him because of his accent and then you miss some stuff. And he doesn't really connect the readings to lecture which is frustrating.
He tries hard to connect with the students, and tries to make funny jokes. However, he does have an accent which is difficult to understand. Alongside, his exams are straight forward.

Lecture content is secondary to textbook content. Exam was straightforward (2 essays, 2 hours). Some articles from the textbook can be quite dry, but if you attend all tutorials you will absorb all of the summaries from the presentations. Professor is a bit incoherent at times due to his accent, but take notes and you will be fine. Good course.

Decent prof and kind of a clown but the course consisted of the worst, most boring, and uninteresting readings I have ever read in my two years at this school. I would rather read philosophy articles than "The Judgment of Thamus" or "The Medium is the Message". I actually got angry while reading because of how boring the readings were.

I wasn't so sure about him at first, but I found that I liked him more as the course went on. A bit hard to understand at times due to his accent, but I found the most interesting parts of the class was when he referenced his own life in Bangladesh.  content was a little dry, slides a bit confusing, but overall course is ok
he is extremely helpful and clear about the instruction of teaching me how to do essay!! he is my best teacher ever!!!
Bad instructor

sometimes i just close my eyes when i walk crossroads so i can d!e on my way to her lecture.

im definitely changing my major all because of her thanks

The slides are minimal, as most of the content is explained verbally. However, her explanations are very clear with examples. Make sure to take notes, cause they will be crucial for your exams and assignments. She is very caring and patient, always answering questions thoroughly until you fully understand.

She is pretty chill and funny and all u need to score in her class is taking notes and using that in the exams since its open book exams. Her grading is also pretty chill and not too strict and she is really nice.

She is one of best prof i have come across!! She is very caring and its super easy to score A in her class if u take good notes and use that in your exams since her exams were open book. Her grading is not that tough either so it was a pretty chill time w her thru out the sem.

The articles to read are heavy, however if you take notes in class you will be fine. She cares a lot about students and is very funny!
She tries her best to engage you in class. The material can be quite stressful and overwhelming but if you pay attention in class and later on explain it in the exams you'll be fine ;)
Take notes, good grade.

Caitlin is my favourite professor, no doubt about that. Her lectures are clear, and she cares about her students. She gives the freedom to choose essay topics. Enjoyed her class. Her dog is so cute. Took her class in the Fall of 2019. Highly recommend.

she is a great professor , and she explains things very well.
the fact that students cannot read  a syllabus thats not her problem.

She's amazing! she's the type of professor who gets you engaged in the class. The readings might be boring and tedious but when you connect them with recent subjects you understand everything better. Assignments are kinda hard when you don't read. She will explain everything amazingly, her class has been my fav so far <3

Valuable and rich lectures that carry most of the important key terms in the semester. And more importantly the lectures are actually interesting. She explains important theories and modern conflicts in the world of communications in the best way. However, it might get difficult if you dont know how to effectively study for it.

Good prof. Her lectures are engaging and she is very knowledgeable about the course content. Unfortunately for me, the course had waay too much writing in it, which is why I found it a bit difficult. Recommended if writing is your strong suit

This is my first time taking a university level course as an international student and im so glad I was instructed by Caitlin! She is a really good person. To get straight As just attend all her lectures, take notes, submit assignments on time and thats it! She gives credits to the working and planning as much as the content :)

Still one of the best Prof I've ever had. She is passionate about CMNS and it shows in her lectures. It's always interesting to learn from her as her examples are relevance and up-to-date. She is tough tho you you gotta work hard to do well in her class! Recommended if you wanna feel inspired, not if you wan't easy A

The best prof I've ever had. The lectures are very interesting and some hard readings are more clear after them. I just really enjoyed all of the lectures and was always happy to be in class. Participation matters but it is very easy to be engaged in the conversation.
The best prof I've ever had. The lectures are very interesting and some hard readings are more clear after them. Just really enjoyed all of the lectures and was always happy to be in class.

She is a really nice professor. I know that many students are blame on her, I can tell that the problem is on students themselves. The first time I failed because I did not do the reading and listen to class. For the second time, I work hard and go to meet her in office hour(Caitlin is so patient for every question I have like filling in classnotes

One of the best professors, her lectures are incredibly interesting. Just make sure to listen and take notes. Try to participate in class and take notes as her slides are just a quarter of the overall material discussed. Exams and assignments are also pretty easy.

I took her course twice got a C- for the first time coz i was super sick in final exam Really helpful, experience and wonderful lecturer Useless powerpoint lolonly provide several keywordsthus you hv to attend lecture got a A- in the second time

everyone says she is not a good teacher, however that's because she makes you work for the grades. She has a perfect method of making the students get involved in her course material. However, IF YOU ARE TAKING THIS COURSE AND HER FOR FUN AND LIGHTLY, THIS IS NOT FOR YOU. You have to take notes, read, write and understand to pass with good grades.
get ready to read b00is.
Boring lecture with lengthy words, worry about further study
Be prepared for the worst. Very easy course but taking with her will make it very heavy. Tough grader and does not easily give grades

She is really nice, cool, and helpful, whenever you have questions she will give you her attention. To get a good grades in this class you really need to work for it. She is critical in terms of grading, but her lectures are fun and interactive. One of the best teacher that I know.
really enjoyed her class wouldn't mind taking her classes in the future.

I think working on her accent would make a significant change on her teaching. Her accent is very strong and even though she tries to help students, sometimes is difficult to understand what she is trying to explain/say because of her accent.

I took her class asynchronously and it was hard, unclear and miserable. I dont even know why I have this or that grade, there was no feedback, it was hard to communicate or understand her idea, everything is so clueless and unclear, or even bored, meaningless and hopeless. Should not take her, only if you want to read a lot and good guessing

Her teaching voice is a bit boring but she is actually very knowledgeable and willing to explain more of a problem for you. Her slides are informative and good enough for you to pass this course with her. A very nice prof. Her CMNS 110 is a bit easier than 130 so 110 with her could be a GPA booster!
She's is a great teacher with a enormous amount of knowledge, her lecture slides are very informative and that's all you need to get an A in her class. Moreover her class is very fun and interactive.
Best professor for CMNS110.
she is a good teacher and very knowledgeable. She is always available if you have ay doubts. Had a little difficulty with her english but she covers it up with good teaching.
The best professor ever met. She is really great and super easy. If you wanna get an easy GPA boost, take her course please

Scott really wants everyone to do well in his class. If you don't show interest and demonstrate an effort to succeed don't expect him to spoon feed you. He marks fairly, again, if you put in the effort you get good grades, if you don't care to work hard than don't expect an "A". He is also pleasant to have a conversation with, very approachable.
He has high standards but he clearly put a lot of effort into his lectures. If you pay attention in the lectures you can do well in his class.

Horrible prof. This was the first prof that I ever had that came in the tutorial and swore at us just cause we didn't do the readings one time. lectures are boring to the point that not attending is basically the same as going. Highly would not recommend

His philosophy background is apparent in lectures. He has an impressive vocabulary, which is advanced for first year. The assignment structure was fair and easy. Essay questions are somewhat vague, allowing for students to think on their own. He has high expectations that students care about engaging with material, which is not unreasonable.
He can make a simple thing very complicated. Papers are extremely hard and the guidelines are very vague. So hard to stay awake in his lecture.

so hard to understand what he is saying most of the time. lectures are not helpful at all. thank god for the nice TA. take him if you don't care to learn anything and are good at writting essays with no help.
most boring lecture I have ever attended in my life. The guy still loves philosophy so he heavily incorporates it into the lecture. Tough, boring, dry, not a class I would recommend

For the first few lectures he read off of his notes like a presentation but after a while, when he started to speak from experience and knowledge his lectures were more interesting. His lecture content isn't really related to textbook but exams will be on both. Attend class and read your articles!

Scott was an excellent ta, though he often came off as snobby and a know it all. my biggest regret in this class is that i didn't ask him to go to the pub after our final class. One of the most interesting, well spoken, rational and coherent people I have ever met. my cmns exam tmrw and am 100% confident that i am going to do great. THANK YOU SCOTT

David Firman was my t.a for a first year Cmns course. I will say I hated that man. I think he was too tough for 1st years. But now that I think about it, I think his harsh criticism really taught me something. I dropped communications because of him and now I'm taking it again.
easy going and interesting
He is a good prof. He makes communiction interesting with different  down-to-earth examples. He can also explain things pretty well.  He is also happy to help you with things you don't understand.

course requirements and syllabus are unclear essay marking criteria not given essay topics vague and poorly written course is waaaaaaaaaaay too difficult for first year communications professor is arrogant
Tina is great, she is patient, nice and helpful.

he clearly cares about high performing students (the better you do the stricter hes gonna be on you) but he's def a tough grader. His classes are stressful because if you lose track it's hard to catch up since his slides are really confusing. lecture style isn't all that bad but sometimes he pretends you understand and stop explaining
Discriminate against my classmates and say I have a credibility problem because I'm Chinese
Cold attitude towards students, not telling me when I ask questions, leaving me to read the textbook myself
When I asked a question, he didn't give me an answer and said how I didn't know so simple
The content of the lectures and the exams do not match seriously, and the lectures do not follow the textbooks.

This professor introduced the course syllabus in the first week by saying that if you don't manage to fully understand the class just choose to drop the class. I am confused that as a professor, he should accept students' lack of understanding of the course instead of advising them to withdraw from the class in the first week of the school year.
To be fair, Professor ken is not that bad. I just think he may have some problems in his head.
Harassment of students

ken is one of the most useless teachers I have ever met. He makes students sleepy, and never gives you any comments. He always has a high sense of superiority and thinks students are idiots. If you want to go to jail, then you choose him!

This professor always likes to undermine students' self-confidence. I thought I could get a satisfactory grade by working hard for the first week, unfortunately, he gave an F in the After Class summary. The PPT of the class was boring and the lecture was conducted using audio which was not easy to understand.

Used Marxist text and theory when lecturing, which was eyebrow-raising. I found it weird that I was learning about capitalism, elitism, and racism when learning about how ideas intersect. Tangential at best.

Exam periods and conditions were very well defined, however. Appreciated the good composition and teaching structure of the slides.
classes were good but a very writing intensive Course. not recommended.

He grades CMNS110 like it is some CMNS330 course. Expects the very best from the students even when he teaches in a haywire manner. He will not explain things properly intentionally because it makes the student's job easier. Do not be fooled by his rating. Literally, all his assignments were essays. Setting such standards for an entry-level course.

Ken is one of the best teachers I have ever had in my life, he structures the course in a way that makes it easy to follow, his enthusiasm is off the charts and he actually cares about you if you put in the work, his lectures are interactive and he does his best to simplify everything with real life examples, i'd recommend no one else to teach CMNS
He is an extremely enthusiastic teacher with interesting and easy-to-understand lectures.
Ken is really passionate about what he is doing. Basically, if you want to get good marks, show him that you do work hard.

Love his lecture sooooo much!! It was really interesting and he gave a lot of examples that let you understand the concepts easily. Dont skip classes! Ken is easy going and friendly. He speaks fluent English and a bit accent with Cantonese and Mandarin. He also won the FIC Teaching Award in 2019 Spring. He marks fairly but the short q. quite hard.

He is the best teacher I've ever learned even though he said a lot. Course with lots of readings, insightful lessons. Read books if you want high scores. Classes have 2 lesson summary articles, 1 mass culture assignment, 1 final essay. His class is really interesting, take it. He inspires very well through lesson examples.
tough class. the professor is rubbish
GREAT LECTURER. Too bad the course is incredibly boring. He tried his best to make it interesting though. TA marked too hard though. Textbook was also very boring.

All of his lectures are uploaded and everything said can be found in the readings. A not-too-hard course, as long as you listen and follow the readings. No surprises on Midterm or Final. It was an okay course, but not spectacular. Probably because my TA wasn't all that into the tutorial, but was nice in general.
Amazing prof. Amazing public speaker as well. Very interesting course. Amazing help in office hours as well. Take this course if you want a GPA booster.

Alright, if you want a grade booster, this is THE course. Super easy course; materials are somewhat interesting yet useless; the best thing is that the sample MT he gives out is what he actually gives you on the MT, and he clearly tells you what he tests you on the final on his review session. Highly recommended as a grade booster!
STUART POYNTZ IS THE BOMB
Good guy, good professor, helpful, engaging during lectures, passionate and was very open to questions during the final prep session. Recommended!
Awesome prof! clearly loves to teach and his lectures are engaging.
Knowledgeable, articulate, engaging- everything you'd want in a professor.

Stuart is the BEST lecturer I have ever had!!!  He is so fascinating when he talks, I loved going to his lectures.  The course itself is not so difficult either, just make sure to do the readings and attend your tutorials.  Start the final paper early, some of the topics are unrelated to the course content.  He shows movie clips during lecture. :-D
didnt like cmns, but liked him. makes sure students understand and tried to keep the subject interesting. no suprises on mt or final. he's a nice guy

He made class fun and interesting most days. The readings were interesting for the most part, but he still was very engaged and wanted students to be engaged which is a lot better than most profs. class was relatively easy if you pay attention to lectures and main themes of the readings (i.e. the notes) the exams are pretty easy and straightforward

honestly one of the nicest profs. cares about students and does his best to make  dry, boring material understood & intersting. very accommodating for additional help.  final and mt had no surprises, right from lecture slides & easy 10 pg essay. dont like cmns, but like this prof

He's awesome! So passionate about the class and entertaining to listen to. Gives you a great set of notes to go along with his lectures and is always ready and willing to help when you have a question. I really enjoyed this course!

You know what? You guys are bitter. He is one of the first profs at SFU who has made me passionate about a subject! He approaches his students on a first name basis and even emailed me with suggestions of references I should check out for my term paper. He is not a garbage prof at all. He is enlightening and passionate about what he teaches and kno

Funniest professor I've ever had. Holy cow! I can't believe learning can be this funny and thorough simultaneously. He has seriously raised my standards for a professor. If I could give an SFU professor an Oscar, I would immediately hand it to professor McCarron.

took this course as a gpa booster. gary is an awesome prof and his lectures are interesting. i never did the weekly module readings and still did well. i 100% encourage you to go to your tutorials -- they were mandatory and your TA helps with your understanding of the content. take this course if you're a good writer! [spring 2022]

Gary is funny and engages with the students. The TAs are pretty good too!
Take this course if you're a good writer. Easy A!
His lectures are extremely engaging and interesting. He is a caring professor and his lectures are well prepared. Highly recommend this course.

Dr. McCarron is a super smart guy, definitely knows what he is talking about. His lectures are actually really interesting with his enthusiastic personality and anecdotes. My only issue is that he just felt like a lecturer, not as much of an educator. CMNS 110 involves a lot of self-teaching, which isnt really his fault.

It is very easy to fall behind in this class as lectures were pre recorded and there was no tutorials. However if you stay on tasks and do the readings and check out the lecture slides you'll be fine. I would have benefited from the tutorial time, as its a class where we talk about the material and understand what's going on, other than that its ok

Probably the worst prof I've ever had. When I asked why my paper was graded low, he said it was because I got a low mark on my midterm. I would stay away from Gary, his lectures are pointless and boring, exams are all on the readings, which ae very dry

Amazing prof. Inspired me to change majors to cmns. Interesting and engaging lectures. Well-informed with pop. culture. One of the best memories at SFU. Would definitely take more classes with this prof. You learn AND you have fun!

The online course is just mountains of reading, extremely irritating online discussions which, unless you get very lucky, you have to drag your group-mates through, and writing assignments. If you like the topic, you might like the course; if you have a passive interest, just take something with less reading because it will monopolize your time.

CMNS has a lot of readings, duh, but the lecture is where it is at. Gary is a fantastic lecturer and has honestly been the main reason why I switched majors. He knows how to make every topic (even the dreary ones) interesting and keeps lectures entertaining. If you have trouble with anything him and his TAs are fantastic. Really recommend this one.
Gary was an amazing prof! Funny and gave many interesting examples that aided the points of the lecture. He made dry course content as easy to follow as possible, overall great prof.

How can you go wrong with a guy that drops an F bomb right in the first lecture? Gary is engaging, incredibly intelligent, knows his stuff and passionate. He is the reason that I am pursuing CMNS. However, be prepared that he doesn't talk about the readings at all. Great prof, would highly recommend!

He gives great examples to help students understand broader concepts and his exams were better than i thought ! Just make sure to read the readings and listen in tutorial very well; I feel that the grades really depend upon the TA you get since they are the ones marking your exams and term paper. But i don't recommend this as gpa booster!!
Great teacher, easily the best prof at SFU, the way he talks to you when you approach him gives you confidence
Gary's lectures are interesting and fun. You'll get really engage in the stories he tells!
Absolutely the most entertaining lectures I have ever been to. Gary is the sort of guy you would want at your holiday suppers.

Such an awesome professor. The course material is interesting, and the prof really keeps it entertaining. It's not an easy A type class, but it is so interesting to me that I want to put in the extra time to study. I think because of this prof, I'll pursue a degree in communications.  I love going to my lectures and tutorials for this class.

His lectures are very dry and he puts an excessive amount of text on the slides. The TAs were nice but not helpful at all. This course brought my whole GPA down and it doesn't even count for WQB. It was my first communications class and it completely turned me off the whole field. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

Honestly, this professor is why I'm pursuing communication studies. He is one of the best professors I've had at SFU. The readings can be dryish, but the readings are essential to understand the course. As well, lectures are quite important, as he expands on ideas necessary to grasp an understanding of the course. If you take 110, take it with him!

Honestly the class material is so simple that a prof isnt even needed. It doesn't even matter how he's teaching it. I read over the lecture notes a few hours before the exam and still ended up with a B. If your TA is Adam Bajan you'll do great.
Good knowledgeable prof. Although if you're not a communications major/minor I don't recommend this course, as you will not gain learning to use beyond the course.

This professor is not a "bit dry" he is EXTREMELY dry. He often goes off tangent for extremely long time making it hard to grasp the importance of anything. Lectures are just a 3 hour long ramble. He's a nice guy though

Good Prof. Although if you run in a situation where you need extra help, he will not provide any special consideration for anyone, regardless of bad they need that extra help. He does not answer emails.
Course material was a bit dry, but he delivered it in such a humorous way. If you keep up the reading, you will do well on this course. Definitely recommend taking it! :)
The class is dry sometimes but it is helpful. Should understand the contents of the lecture and u will be fine.
Great professor! Lectures are always interesting and fun. Take this class!

He's a very engaging teacher. You can tell that he loves his subject and always has a funny tale to tell.  My advice is to make sure you do all of the readings and to take notes on the overall article.  His exams consist of 2 essays.  If you know some of the readings really well and kinda know the rest of them you'll do fine.
He is one of those professors you love going to - an awesome guy who knows his material VERY well and always has a fun story to tell
really engaging prof, has a great sense of humor. i'd love to go for a beer with the guy haha. lectures aren't mandatory but the subject matter is pretty interesting!
He's a really good professor. Some of his lectures may be a bit boring but he tries to engage you.
He is really funny and nice. He has a lot of great stories. made me wanna stay in communications, not like 130 ( dead boring course about policy). Definetly a YES!!

Interesting content, presented through discussions and examples. This course is very writing intensive: weekly written assignments, 10 pg term paper, and a midterm & final with 2 essays each. Requires a lot of effort for an elective; would not recommend unless willing to invest a lot of work for a course that is not easy credit.
Only gets intersting halfway through. First 6nlectutes are boring, last 6 are great. High use of textbook.you Learn a lot, but at the end it doesn't feel like you have.
Really funny and interesting, keeps students engaged.
Gary is a great prof! He tries to put examples into his lecture notes just so we understand. The content of the course mostly focuses on history.

Gary is awesome. He has great anecdotes that will keep you amused and he records the lectures. Excellent prof, doesn't take much to get a good grade. Subject matter is not always exciting, its a survey course so you learn a little about lots but no crazy details about anything

Gary is a great lecturer. He is engaging and entertaining. He posts up the slides and recordings which is very helpful. Your marks all depend on your TA because they mark your assignments. The questions are clear and understandable.
Great guy, fantastic speaker. Really knows how to captivate and motivate. The material isn't that difficult. Do the readings and you will be golden.

Super entertaining prof. Nice guy and a great speaker. Keeps the material fresh and relevant. Staying on top of readings becomes somewhat important in exams, but how much you use the text in class and marking of papers is up to your TA.

Lectures were generally interesting, but make sure that you keep up with the readings as there are several per week which will build up fast. Readings were sometimes dry but TA Jenny's tutorials were interesting and useful to help understand the material. Exams were essay-style, study a few topics in-depth rather than have a broad understanding.

Gary is a great prof! His lectures are really interesting if you pay attention and his TA's were pretty fair with marking. Probably not the best class to take as an elective though. In order to do really well, you should be interested in the topic.
Gary made this class quite interesting with all of his great examples. Tests were quite difficult for a 100 level class. TA, Graeme was extremely helpful and made the material easier to understand.

Good with his material, but talks quiet, impossible to hear him. Not very helpful during office hours, seems to be in a hurry. Exam questions aren't hard, but his expectation for answers is WAY too high for a 100 level course. Missed office hours due to his cat. Funny prof., makes material seem interesting. His TAs structures tut very differently.
His voice is too low, cant really hear him
hes a good prof. only one of the few that can actually speak english. funny at times but he mumbles a lot and his tests are hard. really hard.

Gary is such an incredible man super knowledgeable, and very caring. He was my prof in my first year, and is still one of my favorite profs to this day (3rd year now) He is clear and concise, and his TA's are super helpful. Make sure to do the readings and put time into the papers. This class was awesome!

Simply impressed by Gary !!! I take this course bcoz I don't have a complete schedule, not for any interest. However, after taking it, I have to admit that Gary eases my pain and fear of writing and reading since English is not my first language and this is the first semester of my first year. For mid-term, I'm a little bit nervous. After MT, I alm

great prof. the only problem i found is that he rarely used notes and just talked for the 2 hr lecture which made it sometimes hard to concentrate on what he was saying. i never did the readings as relying on tut presentations was sufficient. tests were on the key terms he talks about in class so you really only need to understand the main ideas.

generally a passionate prof. mais witty and charming. material was a bit sketch.when asking for help, he just tells us to go the TA's. the main problem with this course are the TA's - they are all coming from different levels! some are wayyy too easy and some are wayyy to hard (rahat). id say this course will only be good with certain TA's

A good prof. makes the class interesting. Stay away from T.A Rahat Imran as another person said. I'm second year, and for a first year class, the T.A and prof were Very unclear about the essay! Exams are ok, difficult to know what to study for. Not as easy as you think it is.

Favourite prof this semester...genuinely interested in his work, really friendly and most importantly NOT boring! Enjoyed his lectures very much. (For the final make sure you review lecture notes as well as text, generally the exam was not too bad)
Good prof, interesting style of teaching.  Stay away from RAHAT IMRAN - a TA for this course; she is horrible.

He's clear and funny, and acknowledges the fact that a 2 hr lecture is tiring so he does his best to keep everyone interested which is really nice! seems like a genuine guy who is absloutely brilliant!
One of the best profs I've ever had. A brilliant person and talented lecturer. Never used notes or power point (love it!) Very funny. This is a class and a prof you don't want to miss!

LOVE YOU GARY! If you want to understand COmmunications at its foundations and enjoy your learning as well...it's essential you take Gary's class. He made me fall in love wiht COmmunications and lit the path for me
The best prof in teaching you the material in the most interesting way possible. However, having a good TA probably makes your grade. Overall, the course was not too demanding.
The Best Ever!!!! I looked forward to his lectures every week and I can't say that about many other profs. He'll make you love higher education.
VERY interesting material, it is easy course content although it is impossible to get an A overall in the course. Covers a lot of different areas, makes you really think about things.

I have the worst attention span on the face of the earth.  This prof really held my attention 99% of the time, and that says a whole lot!  Excellent job, fantastic proff (best I've had so far), keep it up!
Very interesting prof, and clear of his teaching. He's really nice! take it, otherwise u'll be regret!!

Gary is the greatest lecturer I have ever had.  Really interesting. Only problem is huge class... no interaction w/ Gary only with TAs and they can be quite bad. Readings can by tough and if your TA is no good it can be hard.
I would reccomend not taking this class with Gary when you are almost done at SFU.  The reason is that I did and now I am staying to take a communications minor.  His passion was intoxicating.

Gary McCarron is the best prof at SFU... ask anyone whose taken his class. The material is cool, the readings are long but interesting, and I HATE reading. Every lecture is different, and engaging... highly, HIGHLY recommended. For tests, make sure you know the readings well.

very interesting prof..he talks funny and the material are realli interesting that you would acutally look forward to the next lecture! Tho he talks realli realli fast...exams are not that hard ..u gonna keep up w/ the readings!

As a business student, i can say that his style is different. No notes, not overheads. Buy a notebook for this class, if you don't already have one, because he talks very quickly so you need to keep up. Pretty hard class for a 1st year class, but very intersting!

Gary's lectures are wonderful to listen to because of his intelligence, wit, experience, and unassuming style; however, he is quite by-the-book and can be quite strict. He could also be more clear--talks too quickly and spends too much time on interesting, semi-related anecdotes and not enough on testable info.

Gary is the best prof I've had so far at SFU. He's the most interesting lecturer I've ever encountered. His two hour lectures just fly by. No two lectures ever feel the same. Good teaching style, good sense of humour, knows how to keep an auditorium packed with students entertained.
A nice professor with a good sense of humour who had excellent lectures. Good class.
Great class.  Teaching was clear and interesting.
Great sense of humour, good lectures, clear instructions and a nice guy.

im writing this after taking a number of cmns classes and i must say garry has been one of my favorite profs! he's got some interesting stories that link to the material and his lecture is never boring, 2 hrs of lecture flew by
Great prof! He makes lectures interesting with anecdotes. the course itself wasn't too hard either.

extremely funny prof!  I agree that his TA's are complete jerks.  I enjoyed attending Gary's lectures but hated, absolutely hated, attending tutorials.  The tutorial presentations, you will find, are useless and will probably put you to sleep.

gary is a pretty nice guy. he tries to make his lectures interesting, but at times the material can be dry. his ta's may not be as nice or as helpful as he is (remember they are the ones marking your paper).

All his lectures are pretty interesting. He really knows what he's doing. You take your own notes, and this was surprisingly more helpful then copying straight off the overhead. The first few readings are boring though.
gary is a nice guy. overall his lectures are pretty interesting. his ta's on the other hand were neither helpful nor clear in what they wanted or how they were marking.

Favorite prof so far at SFU. Lectures and interesting and the examples he provides are useful and clear. He has a great sense of humor and overall has a very good understanding of communications and related topics. Would highly recommend this course, had a great semester with this prof.

Very smart guy, very prepared, and although the lectures don't relate to the midterms, u'll find them interesting and will attend anyway, awesome. A complete **** when it comes to emails though, geez.
Good Prof.  Lectures are ok...still don't really know what the point was though.  Gary was really colorful but my TA was awful...wish he could have facilitated tutorials.
Lectures were really interesting, but the class was totally skippable since lectures don't really relate to the exams at all.

Mccarron is such a smart professor.  He really knows and likes what he teaches. He is the lecturer i've every had.  Lectures without even looking at notes and always gives clear interesting examples!  I wish he was the one i had tutorials with!  Interesting class material as well..  loved it!
Very Professional, Well Structured, very Smart guy
Awesome and funny guy! this course was supereasy! take it with him and you'll get an A
He uses the words "dichotomy" and "autonomous" for everything.  Also, he pronounces "at all" funny
He is such a good prof.  really interesting lecture.
Great Prof.  Always attended lecture and understood everything because of his style.
His lectures are great, but never answers his e-mails.
No Comments
Great guy, does an excellent job with the course material. I'm going to get him a Tshirt
Great Prof, who can teach in an original, interesting way.

His lectures are interesting, but since they were totally unrelated to the midterms I wound up skipping alot of his classes. The TAs have way too much control of your mark in the class. I think this class is too advanced for a first year course.

His lectures are OK. He can be humorous at times (if you get what he means) but he talks pretty fast though. Do take notes because he doesn't post them on the web or anything. Keep up with the readings. Not a lot to do except for discussions in tutorials, a midterm, a term paper, and final.

He is a funny guy. His lectures are interesting in general, but you should take notes in class. Not much work for this class except for exams and one paper. Your mark really depend on the TAs. Overall it's ok.
Funny, explains concepts then asks the lecture hall "Did you understand that?" and usually re-explains in a different viewpoint...awesome!
Very good prof. able to keep the class awake. lectures are very interesting however sometimes the topics are way to broad. There are lots of reading and most of them are not discussed in class.
Excellent prof. Good class. I'd highly recommend it.
the best prof i have ever had. It's a fabulous course that convinced me that CMNS would be my major.
He gives a comprehensive and interesting intro to Communications. Tests and assignments are quite fair. Take this class at the same time as CMNS 130.
No Comments
Gary is the best professor i've had so far. His lectures are interesting, and very relevant to the course. I've definitely learnt a lot from this course.

Overall the best prof one could ask for, nice, friendly, interesting, keeps up-to-date with current events, FUNNY.  Two hour lectures goes by so quick, one does not even realize two hours has gone by until he starts to pack up.  Just one of those not to m
Funny and clear. My favorite CMNS prof by far!! interesting lectures, and tests are ok if you study the material
Entertaining lectures and a very funny guy. His course is a good one to take! His midterm and final were fair but some of the assigned readings were just brutal to read.
Very intelligent, but not overly approachable.  Tough.  Sarcastic.  Sometimes to the point of being mean.
Best prof and class ever.

Recommended for CMNS... Gary is a good example of an intellectual who keeps up with contemporary society, in other words, a fairly good role model. His classes are in high demand. He handles 100 level teaching well, and is very approachable.

Overall excellent. Really interesting and funny to listen to. Personable and approachable. Very good first impression to Communications. The discussions were stimulating and his assignments were good and fair marked.
He is fantastic. his lectures are informative, clear and immensely entertaining. everyone needs to take a course with him

Loved his lecture. Entertaining class. Lectures are not redundant and pointless c/ he doesn't repeat the reading asignment. Would love the class more had it not been for the health alert at the end of the semester.
a really great lecturer, seemed helpful out of class, but the exams had some REALLY obscure question/answers on them, ie. is your purpose to TEACH us or to try and TRICK us and pull a fast one?
good prof. TA's dont help at all and mark extremely hard.he makes info interesting.
Best. Prof. Ever. He managed to make lectures entertaining, yet still thought-provoking. One of the few classes where I actually found myself looking forward to lectures. Highly recommended.
interesting:)

He is a GREAT professor... taking such dry material and turning it into such interesting topics.  He's always willing to help, even though it's not his office hours.  He's over a great prof and you SHOULD take 110 with him.  It's the very best!
excellent lecturer.  such a funny guy.  keeps you interested and entertained even though some of the topics might be boring.
Didn't like his jokes??? Give me a break...Great prof - knows his stuff. Lectures are easy to listen to, uses humour (how many do THAT?) to break up the boring bits.
Uses unneeded profanity in his lectures.  Disrespectful and overall a poor prof.

awesome, brilliant, this guy can really teach, although lectures require distinct focus, mccarron just knows how to really talk to people and beat information into you.  cmns 286 is great too, if you're interested in propaganda...
He was a very good prof. Very approachable and willing to help students in every way he can. The course material is very interesting. He was great but the Ta's were not.
Gary is an excellent Prof.  Helps you stay awake during the lectures!  Most Excellent!
He's soooo GOOD !!!!!
No Comments
Brilliant prof. Great lectures. So many interesting ideas to say. Sometimes makes slightly offensive religious remarks. Overall great prof!
good teacher, offensive jokes, his exams are a bit vague ... not that easy.
No Comments

Gary's awesome...I had him this semester...his lectures are engaging and informative...best professor in my two years at S.F.U....I make sure I show up every time, because if you don't, you miss a lot.
The BEST!!!!!!
Makes you not want to miss a lecture. A good teacher but can sometimes be religiously offensive.
Very funny. Love his jokes!
Great teacher!! Keeps the lectures interesting and is so funny!!!
best lecturer and funny guy
No Comments
No Comments
He is a WONDERFUL teacher, genuine, and eager to help his students out.
McCarron is an AWESOME prof..Seriously, he is THE BEST, clear, concise and FUNNY
McCarron is great! Makes learning fun.
He's the best!  Witty, humourous, yet clear and informative! Interesting lecture
Excellent prof!!! Clear, helpful, funny, intelligent
most interesting prof. I've had so far
Great prof and great lectures
Interesting and funny lectures.Diverse topics.Exams were fair.
No Comments
No Comments
Wonderful prof.
he's so so..  he knows what he's talking about.
great prof who knows what he is talking, explains so that everyone understands
interesting prof & course; some articles in CCW hard to understand; no trick q's
not a boring speaker
2 thumbs up! Great prof.! Passionate about what he teaches!
lots of bs. BUT does teach well and hard to catch up to on notes.
One of my fav profs of all time - hilarious and a great lecturer
No Comments
He's very well spoken and explains thing to death so that is is clear.
No Comments
Knows his stuff.
An excellent and inspired Prof.
AWESOME prof!
No Comments
Made one of my first courses at SFU very enjoyable to attend.
excellent prof!
a very funny guy who makes lectures interesting! he's hilarious!!

A good lecturer but I didn't understand the meaning behind his topics most of the time. His slides were bare. There was a lot of miscommunication between him and the TAs. Darren did do a good job at connecting the topics to "trendy" things depending on the topic of the week which helped to keep me engaged and understand that week's concepts.

Fourth year student here, this is the worst communications proff I have had. Group assignments are annoying and all the assignments are very unclear with vague criteria and no rubric. The TAs for this class were not good either, little communication between the TA and Proff and they did not know what they were doing.

was not a fan of his lectures. Slides were very bare. a lot of the topics felt very vague. Though he is a very nice guy.  Several readings each week. they are quite uninteresting. It is clear he cares about his students. But his teaching style is just not for me.

Great guy and truly cares about his students and teaching. Lec slides are very bare, he talks a lot. In 110, his lectures are mostly just to provide context around the 'key topics' that he is trying to teach. All you really need to do is study the key topics, and he gives you a list 10 days before each exam. I always liked attending his lectures.

He was very friendly and passionate about communications. He tried to make the lectures engaging and refereed to modern media (with some old media stuff mixed in). Lectures were hard to take notes on but all you have to do is wait for him to release the study guide before the exam and review what the keywords are using the slides he posts.

nice guy, but yaps a lot. slides only contain images and long quotes. midterm and final: chose 5 out of 8 questions to answer. very tough to get an A. easy to pass (25% of grade is just participation)

What an amazing professor, wow. he is so funny. He is also a very fair and understanding professor. Very fair marker. Great grade distribution, readings are important but dead boring. The finals are sometimes optional, he is awesome.

I hate this prof, his tone is so low that I kept falling asleep during his lectures. His lectures are dry and he keeps on talking like non-stop. However, the TAs are helpful and their marking scheme are fair. I like the TA much more better than this boring prof.

I took cmns110 with him in Downtown, so we had 3hr lecture, and he talked straight for 3 hours, but it was actually really interesting and I learned a lot, not just dull facts, but practical concepts that relate to everyday situations.

I've had Roman for CMNS 110&253 and he is one of the most interesting and knowledgeable profs around. His lectures are always interesting (although he can go off on a tangent and repeat things - but that can be pretty funny) and if you do your readings and attend most lectures his assignments and exams are very straightforward.

Roman was super interesting! he sometimes went off on tangents unrelated to the course, but he kept you intrigued and he really knew what he was talking about. also, he was funny and was a no b.s kinda guy.

Course wasn't hard. Everything was ok given that you actually read the parts of the textbook that are required for the assignment, presentation and the final paper. Prof likes to swear, apparently he's funny in lectures, but they're not worth going because they don't help you with your work at all.
Awesome teacher! My favourite so far!! His lectures are extremely engaging and he knows his material, both related and unrelated to the course material. Really funny too...without trying!

Roman KNOWS his stuff. CMNS110 is a introductory course and he really tries to give you the back ground knowledge of the study. His lectures are interesting. But all the grading just really depends on your TA. pray that you get a easy TA. Mine wasn't so easy compared to other TAs.

Roman KNOWS his stuff. CMNS110 is a introductory course and he really tries to give you the back ground knowledge of the study. His lectures are interesting. But all the grading just really depends on your TA. pray that you get a easy TA. Mine wasn't so easy compared to other TAs.

Roman is a professor in the true sense of the word.  He is interested in sharing knowledge not just teaching so that you can write an exam or get a job.  This is university is supposed to be about.  For those of you who say that he goes off topic -- go to a technical school if all you want to do is pass an exam and get a certificate.
Everyone loves Roman. Not a lot of readings and he is really funny... but beware if you hate swearing! Haha... He supposedly has a secret class... I'd like to take it.
Great profesor, especially for first-years, keeps it fun and light and you know when he is saying somethin important and when he is just straying off course (which is always fun).
Great prof. He's amazing in lecturing; it's always interesting. Communications isn't my major, but i've been wanting to make it my minor after taking this course. Highly recommend this course.
entertaining but no educational substance.  wikipedia is not sufficient as the ONLY class courseware

First thing's first, his lectures are almost completely useless, and unless you have a HUGE interest in the subject you will find yourself (and 85% of the other students) skipping by the halfway point. The redeeming quality is that he lists the EXACT questions that he will be selecting from for the final. Learn enough of those and you'll do fine.

interesting lectures, but his voice may bore u to sleep. exams are easy just do the math and memorize a few Q's out of the list he gives you to study. There were also pretty long breaks haha which was awesome. Some of the TAs cant speak very good  english...
THIS GUY IS THE FUNNIEST PROF EVER. HE IS THE BEST. THE LECTURES ARE 2 HOURS, BUT HE MAKES HIS LECTURES SO INTERESTING THAT YOU DONT FALL ASLEEP.

Don't listen to the first years; these people will soon be weeded out.  Roman is a great prof.  He's one of the few who actually care about teaching.  You'll do fine as long as you do the readings, and realize that you are no longer in high school.

Left leaning prof.  Not a surprise.  Vulgar.  One joke he made was about finding a tape of our parents “doing it” (and – not that it should at all – but it had nothing to do with the subject matter).  Unprofessional, and vulgar, so not a good prof.  There is worse, but there is also much much better.  What am I paying for?
No Comments

i honestly don't understand what material he wants us to know for the final exam! i wish he would focus his material more, because at this point im extremely lost and his tedious assignments are no help... he also likes huge long fancy words that you have to end up looking for on google... no fun! i don't recommend you take 110 with him!

No structure to his lectures, he just rambles on and on... good if you're comfortable with that teaching style (I'm not). His questions are very ambiguous (you'd have to read it ten times to understand what it's asking). He's probably better as an upper-level prof... but definitely impossible for students hoping to grasp the fundamentals of cmns.

Interesting guy, has a lot to say but when it comes to clarity and getting the point across he is missing something. For a communications professor I would hope he could answer a one sentence question with maybe 4 sentences instead of 4 heavy paragraphs of useless jargon. I'd love to sit and have coffee with the guy but he just isn't my style.

She's friendly but very authoritative. Tons of readings. Toughest grader I've ever seen although she will tell you how much easy the exams are and she wants you to do well. Wouldn't recommend to anyone. Sorry :(

Her lectures are fun and engaging. The final exam is straightforward, and it was really thoughtful of her to provide a practice exam. There was quite a bit of reading in the course, but I'd definitely take a class with her again

She seems like a nice lady but as what other reviewers say… she talks in circles and her lectures are often hard to follow. I think it's brilliant that she is trying to assist the students and seems to care about their well-being but I cannot take these examples that are so cultural and “close to home”.

Not the best professor I had but hey something is better than nothing. I heard worse things about Layla Cameron's class for the same cmns110 course. I'm just glad I didn't take her lol. Sarah is a bit unorganized but gets the work done, she's okay and her work is doable.

No way y'all gunna defend her after this exam. Worst experience ever. She shows up right when the exam starts and then takes up 40 mins of exam time setting up and doesn't give time back. Also her and the TAs spent the exam talking loudly at the front of the room while we wrote.

My TA was amazing, but the lectures were boring and uninteresting. Huge paragraphs on each slides, and this course contains heavy theories for an intro course, and unfortunately the lectures were no help, tutorials were great though, but that depends on the TA. Final exam was simple. The readings were difficult, so try your best, goodluck lol

I don't really understand some of the comments here since a lot are focused on the course instead of the prof. Yes, this course had a lot of readings and we had to write a lot. But that's what I expected and I think it's more of a curriculum problem rather than the professor. Maybe I was more prepared for that because I had friends who took 110.

Took 202 with her this semester. The prof goes on tangents but she knows her stuff when talking about her research. I definitely think that she would be a better prof in an elective course. Overall, the class was easy and she was willing to provide feedback if you went to her.

Topics are quite interesting, but the prof is kinda unorganized and grading varies from TA to TA. overall I wouldnt take this course if you're considering this as an elective, it's not a lot of work but each assignment + the final exam weigh a lot.
The class was dry but the prof was really nice. She was really accessible during office hours and understanding with deadlines.

there were so many weekly readings. her final exam consists of a short written essay at least 5 pages double spaced. so get ready to write. overall fair exam but imo handwritten essay part was really unneccessary. i would say its hard for an introductory course.

I wouldn't say I hated having her as a prof but the class overall was just time consuming because of how we were expected to do weekly readings which could include 40+ pages of material. The readings were also hard to understand and way too convoluted. The TA I had was somewhat fair with marking and the final was really chill.

There are many difficult readings and unclear explanations during lectures. The slides consisted of quotes from the readings, and some examples she used was questionable. And also, writing an 8-10 page paper was very difficult with the topics she provided. This was quite difficult for an introduction class...

Overall, this class was very confusing, and the readings were unclear and difficult to understand. However, the TAs were lenient with grading. The lectures were not helpful, as the professor often just posted quotes and a few key terms. If you're going to take this class,  choose a different professor or be prepared to teach yourself everything.

For an introductory class, this is hard. In the final exam, you're supposed to write an essay based off a quote from her lectures, and minimum of 5 pages, double spaced. So get ready to read and know all the authors of the articles! Exams were fair if you studied her final review!
She talks in circles in her lectures. The content is extremely heavy for a first year course.

Never take again. It's hard to understand her and there are many readings. Her lecture slides aren't useful at all since it was just quotes from the readings which you can read on your own and you have to teach yourself the whole course. For a first year course, the difficulty and amount of content was absurd.

Sarah was incoherent in her lectures and hard to understand. She did a terrible job at explaining course concepts and would just read quotes word for word during lectures. The lecture felt all over the place. Also, there was an 8-10 page paper in this class which feels absurd for an intro-level communication course.

Avoid! The lectures were very confusing and it didn't really make sense to go since she would just add screenshots of the readings to the slides presentation. She was not helpful when I needed help, and honestly kind of rude about it. Avoid at all times! Not even the TA's understood her.

Byron is one of the most likeable professors that I've met at SFU. He made our online tutorials easy and fun to attend. He's a genuinely friendly person and will accommodate student requests and needs. Don't expect an easy A or A+ but that can be said for almost every course at SFU.
Byron was super chill and made the online school very easy. A lot of the content in the course is super boring but it is easy. The final was just 2 essays.
very friendly prof. very nice overall. just that. she doesnt use webct. and does not give u update on the mark.

The textbook's readings are a little hard to get into but in the lectures he clarifies everything.Tutorial presentations are helpful as they elaborate on the readings/lectures more.The term paper, midterm, and final was pretty straight forward.Best CMNS prof out there! :)

Darryl is a very good teacher. There are some teachers that shouldn't be teachers and then there are some who should. Darryl is just one of those teachers that has it. Lectures are very interesting. The reading material can be dry and complex but Darryl makes it easy and simple. He is highly recommended! Very easy-going and friendly! :D
One of the best CMNS profs at SFU!
He is one of the nicest instructor I met at SFU. His teaching was very clear and he was very helpful and friendly!

Listen to a lecture and u will pass, even no need in readings, but readings speed up passing exams and understanding lectures and concepts. Lectures are clear, humorous and simple. Useful tips, told us how to look for sources for an essay. A great understanding prof. Wish I could take this class in first semester as a freshman.
very nice
Great guy! All you have to do is attend lecture, and you will get great mark.
the best prof I've ever seen!!!
Amazing pro, I really really want to take more class with him!! All of 200level class key points more or less had mentioned in his class. Make lecture easy to follow.
Best Professor i have ever seen
WONDERFUL PROFESSOR
Likes the sound of his own voice, this little fella.  And if, faute de mieux, you hafta study with him, bring a book to read while he lectures.
he is really helpful that I learn a lot from his lecture he is the motivation why I study cmns funny guy, I like him if you have any question, just go and ask him
JAMIE IS AWESOME! HE IS THE BEST! LOVE HIM!
He is amazing. Fun lecture, easy explanation (using Justin Bieber a lot), fair exams.  If you put enough effort your grade will be fair enough.
He is a great teach if you do want to learn sth. useful and interesting.

This professor is just amazing. He explains the course material in great detail with lots of great examples all the while keeping it humorous. CMNS110 can be boring course but he makes it so much fun that you want to go to the lecture. So few teachers have this skill and he excels at it. If you skip class though, you will probably fail.
He's a very funny guy though it's hard to get high grade in his class but definitely not a low one if you participate every class, pay attention  to his lectures and take some notes.
Jamie is the best prof! Don't hesitate, just take his classes. His lectures are funny and have a lot of various information. Make notes during class, it will help you on tests.
He is and awesome prof. and really enthusiastic. his knowledge of the subject is amazing and i loved the lectures.

Jamie is such a humorous guy. He has a very clear teaching style. Once you follow his requirement and put some effort, you will learn a whole bunch of knowledge from his class, even though you may not get very high grade finally.
Interesting lecture and clear speech! He is really a nice guy! Haven't taken 210 yet, but expect to.

My friend's friend who took this class earlier had warned me not to take it and I still did cause lol why not it's online and it's summer. But omg should have listened. Yeah it's all online but there's no feedback, no communication from the prof or Ta and they can't even explain their grading I'm so confused, im doing everything right still no use
They/She doesn't even teach in this course. ZERO Lecture video. They just tell you to watch YouTube videos, read textbook and assigned readings. ZERO teaching

I'd like to say that Layla seems nice, but she's ironically very averse to communicating with students. Incredibly disorganized, too many readings & videos (all of them were dense, most were irrelevant), unclear marking criteria, unexplained mark deductions, little to no feedback, and zero cohesion between Layla & the TAs. Hugely disappointing.
Last day to add or drop classes and this is a sign, definitely don't take her…. EVER
Drop it while you still can....
Honestly speaking unless you absolutely need this course then dont take it with her. Gpa tanker and huge stress. TAs were the incompetent too.

Horrible prof. At the beginning everything will seem fine but wait till the midterm comes and the accusations of using A.I will come flooding in. Unlike in assignments where you can use docs to prove your innocence, for online exams you will have no proof and they will accuse you of ai purely based on AI detectors so good luck. TA grades badly too.
Worst professor, cannot teach. Horrible. Accuses everyone of cheating and no communication. Vague instruction and random grading.

I found Layla to be a good professor. Earlier in the term I had some personal issues and she was open and provided guidance. Although the annotated bibliography assignment could have used a rubric, as long as you give unique examples in your discussion and exam responses and show you understand the content, it is fine.

I've never hated a professor more than her. And clearly her choice of TAs are equally horrible and useless like her. Till the end I didn't understand how the grading worked and on top of that each time I asked them to clarify I was left hanging. They don't respond to emails properly or explain any assignment criteria. Everything is vague.

PLS AVOID THIS CLASS. I have never had such a bad prof in SFU, I wish I went through these ratings before taking her class. She does not teach at all or reply to any emails. The TA's mark very hard and do not explain why you got a certain mark. She accused many students of AI even though she had no proof. Do not take this class, you will regret it!
Absolute ass professor and course. Accusing people of using AI; and even if not, the grading by TAs are just terrible.

Taking this class felt like sending assignments into the void and hoping for mercy. The professor doesn't teach, doesn't explain, and somehow still finds time to accuse students of cheating. If stress, confusion, and silence are your learning style, this one's for you.

Worst prof of sfu. The lowest rating I ever saw here and clearly for a reason. This just proves that if you have a PHD it doesn't automatically qualify you to teach. Zero feedback, vague instructions and almost no communication. And she must be so bored with her life that she's creating drama on her own by accusing most of us of ai cheating. 0/10

I'll give anyone who's seeing this a great word of advice if you value your gpa - don't take her. If you're just here to see whether to take her course for this summer or perhaps its fall for you, then literally DO NOT TAKE. You'll thank me in the future or regret you didn't listen.
Avoid her.
I'm scared I'm gonna fail, not because it will tank my gpa but in case I have to take her dreadful class again. I'd rather jump off a cliff…

Worst professor/teacher I have ever taken in my life. Literally the worst…. I think the spring of 2025 will be a semester I will always remember because of how bad of a professor I got like Layla. Avoid her if you can or get insomnia like me. I couldn't even sleep some nights because of her. The fact that I'm not even exaggerating is truly pathetic

You know it's bad when students are more scared of being too good than failing. This prof teaches you one thing - don't stand out, or you'll get accused of cheating. Which will automatically fail you anyways so ggs
The only thing more mysterious than the course content is whether the professor even remembers she's teaching it. Amazing commitment to not being present.

I've never had TAs make a course harder until now. They couldn't explain anything clearly, responded with one liners, and treated us like we were bothering them. It felt like they were just thrown in with no training. Getting support from them was like pulling teeth. And Layla was basically invisible except for the mass ai accusation email we got.

I admired her work on fat positivity and felt seen by it as someone who resonates with it. But never meet your heroes, she's completely unfit as a professor. Cold, disconnected, and quick to accuse students of AI use. She barely communicates and offers no support. It's honestly disappointing. I took this course cause I looked up to her -was wrong.

Feedback? What feedback? Assignments were returned with vague comments or nothing at all. The TAs were completely useless. They didn't know what was going on either.Grading felt random, and asking for clarification got me nowhere. I still don't understand how I was being marked. It's like they wanted us to stay confused.

Even without ever seeing her face, she managed to create one of the most hostile, miserable learning environments imaginable. No lectures, no help, just vague instructions, cold emails, and constant fear of being falsely accused. It felt like she existed solely to make students suffer. This wasn't a course it was psychological damage.

TAs often did not responding to emails in a timely manner or at all. Her grading scheme was unclear, and new parameters seemed to appear after handing in assignments. She also accused a large portion of the class for using AI on the midterm, her “evidence” being that an online AI detector said so.
Not worth the stress

This professor can only be explained as awful and atrocious. The TA specifically assigned to some in the class barely replies, sometimes they don't answer at all. The marking is awful, the class is not friendly to those who need assistance or are neurodivergent. Steer clear, skip her or take w someone else.

This course didn't just ruin my semester,it made me lose trust in the idea that profs are here to help students learn. The lack of empathy and the baseless accusations created one of the most toxic experiences. Layla seems to love a power trip, bullying students and damaging their confidence. No one deserves to be treated as such.

I've taken difficult courses before, but this was something else. Not because of the content, but because of how poorly it was run. No transparency, no real help, just stress and confusion every week. The professor was cold, the TAs were unhelpful, and any question was met with attitude or silence. It felt like we were all set up to fail.

THIS PROFESSOR IS NOT KIND. USE BIG FANCY WORS, GET ACCUSED FOR AI CHEATING. YOU GOTTA WRITE LIKE THIS, TO NOT BE REPORTED FOR SUSPICION. NO BUT SERIOUSLY THIS PROFESSOR IS THE WORST. NEVER TAKE LAYLA'S CLASS. DOES NOT EVEN TEACH GOOD. NO REPLIES. WORST RATED PROF OF SFU FOR A REASON!!!!

This is one of the worst professors I have ever had in my life. She doesn't post any proper lectures, assignment criteria are not clear and the TA rarely provide feedback for graded assignments and exams. I do not know if it sheer laziness or lack of teaching ability but Layla's conduct is incredibly unprofessional  . Please avoid at all costs.

DO NOT TAKE. The assignment and exam criteria were not clear and not to mention the TA's mark so hard and give you little to no feedback. Weekly assignments require you to do a ton of reading and to watch many videos that are sometimes irrelevant and a waste of time. The exams consist of 6 questions (400-500) words each in 3 hours

She hasn't replied to my emails for more than a week. Sent it on April 12th and still no reply. And before that she accused us of using AI, and their evidence is just ai detectors? The TA grades very randomly and provided no explanation for their methods. It's a complete online class so they just throw around accusations without proper evidence.

If being ignored, blamed and judged for existing is your academic vibe, this course is so for you. The trauma bonding with classmates? Iconic. RMP, Reddit, course evals, and even student support services, everyone's talking about Layla and her accusingTA, love this for her 😍
If it's her then just don't even bother

Layla Cameron… this name is etched into my brain. Every day I think of this professor and I wonder why I didn't check her reviews before taking her class. Biggest mistake of my life. Worst professor of Simon Fraser university….

How is Layla even a professor? I know this is an online course but I don't see how she contributes at all. Any concerns u bring to her she redirects u to the TA. And like everyone has been saying, the AI accusation issue is actually insane. The TAs are the worst TAs chosen. They are not liked and I can see y. I hope they don't get picked again ever

I had a really disappointing experience in this class. The professor frequently accuses students of using AI without clear evidence. It feels like we're being penalized for things we didn't do. It creates a stressful environment. I think it's important treat students fairly and communicate openly. Wouldn't recommend this class unless things change.

If you write well or use proper English, be prepared to be accused of using AI with no real proof, just suspicion. The professor and TAs offer no real support and handle concerns poorly. It's a frustrating experience from start to finish. Take this course with someone else if you want a fair chance at success.

This professor made the course an absolute disaster. Nothing was explained properly, grading felt random and any time you needed help, you were met with cold responses or told to deal with it yourself. The stress this class caused was unreal. If you value your GPA or sanity, do not take this course. You'll regret it.

Layla Cameron is one of the most disengaged professors I've had. Lectures feel unorganized, feedback is vague or missing, and there's little to no support when you ask for help. She doesn't seem to care about student success or understanding. It felt like we were just left to figure everything out on our own.

Grading criteria are unclear and both the professor and the Teaching assistants are unhelpful. She accuses students of using AI without proof and deflects responsibility to the TA or ombudsperson. The TAs are poorly chosen and make the experience worse. Avoid if you can.

The course itself isn't hard, but the professor makes it extremely difficult to pass. If you're a comms major, try taking it with another instructor. If you're not, avoid it altogether. it's not worth the stress caused by poor teaching, unclear expectations and harsh grading. Don't take this course for the summer, fall or spring. Be warned.

Don't take her, TAs' are not good either. This is not a gpa booster, quite the opposite it will worsen your gpa. So if you're looking to improve your gpa then turn away. It's not even about whether you can do it or not it's about the lack of communication from her part and apparently her accusations of using ai. Not accessible or considerate.

I wouldn't even want my worst enemy to take her class. She replies to me lesser than my ex did. She accuses me of cheating more than my dad has accused my mom of cheating on him. She and her puppet TA's provide no explanation for the grading like how I was left without an explanation by my ex.
Accused me of using AI and to prove my point I ran it through Turnitin, which decided my answer to be human (100%).

Layla is not very good at communication ironically for a comms course lmaooooo. Sent her so many emails and either they are really late reply or no reply. She and her TA have tagged teamed up to make everyone's lives harder.

Avoid this course online. The prof and TA rely too much on AI detectors. It's discouraging especially when no proper chance is given to explain. If you write well  then be careful it might get flagged unfairly. Also their grading makes no sense either.

WORST PROFESSOR I REPEAT WORST PROFESSOR WITH THE WORST TAs. Accuses EVERYONE of using AI. This course is a trap to lower your GPA. Please do your research before taking this course. I will be advising everyone I know not to take her class EVER AGAIN!!

it's actually alarming how this prof shows a severe lack of empathy towards her students. she doesn't bother replying to emails or making accommodations for students if they really need it because it's an “inconvenience” for her. i've had some bad profs in the past but I've never seen anything like this…

She has zero communication with the TAs. The TAs have different expectations then the ones outlined in her guidelines. She is basically not even teaching the course, it is all just notes, YouTube videos, articles and the textbook. Her instructions are very unclear and the way the TAs mark make no sense.

She doesn't provide rubrics for how assignments will be graded, and also doesn't explain how exams will be laid out or what material will be covered (if it's cumulative or not). Also doesn't reply to emails, and when she does claims it's an “inconvenience”, does not make time for Zoom meetings (online class), TA's are also horrible.

Accuses students of using AI without proof. When confronted, does little to explain - but after I explained I would be taking this to the dean, my grades suddenly changed (still not accurate, but better than what they were). Still hasn't explained or produced evidence for any AI use on my end. Disappointing for a course about media literacy.
I would've recommend class with this professor unless if you're looking for your gpa to drop. I've never had a professor this unwilling to help students.
Makes you do weekly discussion questions. The TAs for this class are not helpful. Criteria for assignments not clear enough.

A lot of comments saying shes rude, but I didn't find that to be the case personally. She responded to my emails very kindly, and I thought she was very understanding. Discussion board assignments were very straightforward. Midterm was a lot of words in a short time frame, if you aren't fast at typing you might struggle.

Layla and her puppet TAs constantly accuse students of cheating with zero evidence.  Extremely fake, as she pretends to be nice but is unwilling to help. When you ask her for help she redirects you to the TA's and tells you not to contact her again.  A truly sorry excuse for a human.  Her TAs are also a mess.

One of the most disorganized professors ever at SFU. She has 0 communication with the TAs and students. 

Please don't take any classes with her, you may lose brain cells trying to figure out the rubric for all assignments.
way too many readings for an introductory class and some of them required subscriptions. assignments are reasonable but midterm and final are 6 300-400 word "short answer" questions

There are multiple long videos and articles to be completed each week (which, let's be honest, nobody did). The midterm and final are ridiculously long and unnecessary, and she labels her questions as "short answers" when there are six questions, all expected to be 400 words. Only take this class if you absolutely have to. Terrible course layout.

I wouldn't recommend this instructor. For an entry level CMNS course, the grading is far too tough. And the module materials were out of sync, meaning that she did not update materials to match up with the current term info, nor the assigned readings with the current textbook. Plus you have to wait 48 hrs for a response, sometimes longer :\
