Layla is a kind professor and the weekly discussions were clear and simple however for a 100-level class she is a harsh marker specifically for exams and assignments. It was difficult to study for the exams as she barely gave any details about the exams. I don't recommend this prof!!

Layla is a kind professor. The assignments and discussion post instructions were clear and at a fair level for an introductory course. However, the exams are straight up unfair and are marked way too strict for an introductory course! Some may say this is a GPA booster but I suggest not to take this course with this prof.

She's really nice. There is a variety of material, assignments are interesting, exams are a bit tricky without notes. But don't take this course if you just want a GPA booster, take it because you are interested in it, or else you might find some of it dry!

Awful prof, I feel like the TAs have done most of the world. The midterm and final exams are freaking BS. 6 short answer questions which require 400 words and you have 2 hours to complete it. So many videos, useless lectures slides, lots of reading, awful course.

I would choose a different professor for this course. Some of the material is interesting but some readings and ted talks she gave us are questionable. I also feel like the information on the lecture slides can be vague and I have to look at outside sources to understand some of the topics. The exams can be stressful as well.

Answered students' questions every time. Straight to the point, easy to understand but has high expectations for mid-terms and the final exam. Would be more helpful if Layla gave us more detail on how to study like "focus more on the textbook readings or the PowerPoint slides." Felt kinda clueless when trying to study for the final.

Tough grader with high expectations in terms of exams, which were said to be based on lecture notes but required a lot of detail from the textbook as well. Lecture ppts weren't really that helpful and parts of the material were regurgitated from previous lectures which made it really confusing at times.
Awesome profs, very helpful. My favourite COMN prof)
Awesome!

All this guy does is talk about his political views he is probably one of the most biased professors Ive seen. Communist propaganda is all throughout his class. Dont take this guy if youre looking to hear an arrogant man flap his gums the whole time.

Awesome teacher. Had him as my prof in Fall 06. He tipped me over the fence and now that there's a SIAT/CMNS joint major, I'm taking it. Was extremely interesting and clear. Got me more interested in the field. Hope he teaches another course for me to take in the future.

Uzleman is a really interesting prof. He made the lectures fun and exciting. When you listen to his lecture it's like listening to a buddy but learning from him. He also likes to use media clips for examples which made the class interesting. Has very witty humour. For an introductory theory course that is hard and dry, he made it very exciting.

Really interesting and fun prof. He uses slang sometimes but it relates to what his point and make students interested at the same time. He likes to use media clips as their tool and it is really useful and straight to the point. The class material was hard to make it interesting as a intro theory course, but I think he really did a good job.

Scott is a great guy, really funny and down to earth.  He is still young enough that he remembers how tough student life can be.  Only complaint is that he is too easy on kids who act like they are still in high school, whining all the time and showing up late every class.  Really good prof though.
Was worried about this prof but he turned out awesome. Does fun stuff in class and always there to help. Best Mass Com prof at CC!
Simply amazing. His passion for communication and media is infectious. Pay attention, you'll do well.

I'm taking the Distance version so I can't say much about his lecture style. My TA Jennifer Garton is extremely helpful though. Her feedback is detailed and her marking is fair. I guess that reflect's Gutstein's marking as well since he sets the standards? Just do the readings and you'll be fine!

I am so glad I took this course with Gutstein via distance education! It allows me flexibility to study whenever I want! The materials are clear!Even though the answers I got from the prof. were short,at least he answered my questions when the TA didn't!!Also, he's willing to re-read my papers and gave me a better grade!!I love HIM!!
Yes, it's nice to see a pretty face in the classroom, but Lana told us once that no one cares about us (the students). I did not learn anything from her
Really great teacher.

Baker was the best prof I had at SFU, he truly cares about the student and helps the student every step of the way. He is responsible and helpful beyond any other prof I have ever had. I strongly recommend his classes to anyone at SFU.

very good professor. very clear lectures, always helped during office hours, was open to new ideas. he cares about students. lectures are interesting, u will never get bored.but textbook was quite confusing. i will be glad to take his course again, but he gone from sfu
really coll professor, always helps with material, open to changes in course context. lectures are interesting, Great Teacher
